Parallel (Work-Stealing and Adaptive Chunking)

Overview

This module provides optional components for parallel scans:

  • ParallelConfig: configuration with sane defaults and environment overrides.

  • AdaptiveChunkController: adaptive chunk sizing with EMA smoothing and clamping.

  • WorkStealingPool: per-worker local deques with top-steal strategy.

  • parallel_scan: convenience helper to run a map/filter scan over a logical range.

API

ParallelConfig

class proto_db.parallel.ParallelConfig(max_workers: 'int' = <factory>, scheduler: 'str' = <factory>, initial_chunk_size: 'int' = 1000, min_chunk_size: 'int' = 128, max_chunk_size: 'int' = 8192, target_ms_low: 'float' = 0.5, target_ms_high: 'float' = 2.0, chunk_ema_alpha: 'float' = 0.2, max_inflight_chunks_per_worker: 'int' = 2)[source]
Parameters:

  • max_workers (int)

  • scheduler (str)

  • initial_chunk_size (int)

  • min_chunk_size (int)

  • max_chunk_size (int)

  • target_ms_low (float)

  • target_ms_high (float)

  • chunk_ema_alpha (float)

  • max_inflight_chunks_per_worker (int)

AdaptiveChunkController

class proto_db.parallel.AdaptiveChunkController(cfg)[source]
Parameters:

cfg (ParallelConfig)

WorkStealingPool

class proto_db.parallel.WorkStealingPool(max_workers, metrics_cb=None)[source]

Simple per‑worker deque pool with stealing from the top of victim queues. Each worker processes tasks that are callables returning an integer count of records processed.

Parameters:

  • max_workers (int)

  • metrics_cb (Optional[MetricsCallback])

Helper

proto_db.parallel.parallel_scan(data_len, fetch_fn, process_fn, *, config=None, metrics_cb=None)[source]

Execute a scan over a logical array of length data_len. The fetch_fn receives (offset, count) and should yield up to count records starting at offset. The process_fn processes a record and returns a possibly transformed record or None to drop it. Results keep no strict ordering.

This helper exposes adaptive chunking per worker on top of a WorkStealingPool. The pool submits only coarse seed tasks initially; workers may locally adapt chunk sizes by re‑submitting tasks to their own deques while respecting an in‑flight bound to protect tail latency.

Parameters:

  • data_len (int)

  • fetch_fn (Callable[[int, int], Iterable[Any]])

  • process_fn (Callable[[Any], Any | None])

  • config (ParallelConfig | None)

  • metrics_cb (Callable[[str, dict], None] | None)

Return type:

List[Any]
